edu.stanford.slac.aida.lib.model

Class AidaProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.slac.aida.lib.model.AidaProvider

  • public class AidaProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates an AidaProvider.

    It is used configure how an AIDA-PVA will operate.

    It has an id to identify the Provider. It has an name to give it a name. It has a description displayed during startup alongside the id and name. The configurations define the different AidaConfigGroup we define for requests to this channel. Finally, the channelProvider defines the actual class that will implement the functionality to service this channel.

    Note that it uses the Data annotation to provide all the getters and setters. a constructor with all required arguments, and an equals(), hashcode() and toString() method.

    It also uses the NoArgsConstructor annotation to provide a constructor with no arguments.

    • Method Detail

      • getChannelNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getChannelNames()
        Get the set of supported Channel Names. AIDA-PVA Providers support both AIDA-PVA and legacy AIDA names for their channels. The list returned will contain both.
        Returns:
        the list of supported channel names

      • getAidaChannel

        public AidaChannel getAidaChannel(java.lang.String channelName)
        Get the channel based on the channel name.

        First, make sure that all config is loaded.

        Channels are matched literally but also by using the WildcardMatcher.match(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to see if any of the patterns specified as supported by this channel correspond to the channel name specified in the request

        Parameters:
        channelName - the channel name from the request
        Returns:
        the AidaChannel object that matches the given channel name
